{{title|Fixed width floating-point types {{mark since c++23}}}}
{{cpp/types/navbar}}

If the implementation supports any of the following {{enwiki|IEEE 754|ISO 60559}} types as an extended floating-point type, then:
* the corresponding macro is defined as {{c|1}} to indicate support,
* the corresponding [[cpp/language/floating literal|floating-point literal]] suffix is available, and
* the corresponding type alias name is provided:

===Notes===
The type {{tt|std::bfloat16_t}} is known as {{enwiki|Bfloat16 floating-point format|Brain Floating-Point}}.

Unlike the [[cpp/types/integer|fixed width integer types]], which may be aliases to [[cpp/language/types#Standard_integer types|standard integer types]], the fixed width floating-point types must be aliases to extended floating-point types (not {{c/core|float}} / {{c/core|double}} / {{c/core|long double}}).

===Example===
{{example|
|code=
#include &lt;stdfloat&gt;

#if __STDCPP_FLOAT64_T__ != 1
    #error "64-bit float type required"
#endif

int main()
{
    std::float64_t f = 0.1f64;
}
|p=true
|output=
}}
